result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Jury trial on August 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Final pre-trial on August 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Frank Sadewater in court with attorney Brian Nelson both appear via zoom. ADA James Kraus appears for the State of Wisconsin in person. Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. 
Minutes filed.
Preliminary hearing on April 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Waiver of Prelim on May 10, 2022 at 11:00 am.
The hearing date is set further out considering time allocation for this hearing to be set due to Attorney Nelson's inability to appear for the entire month of April./kmn

Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): E.M.C. DOB 7-26-2002, R.C., P.C.. NO CONTACT WITH ANY MINORS. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Special prosecutor James Krause in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Frank A. Sadewater appeared in court, Attorney Brian Nelson appeared in court for Frank A. Sadewater. State asking for high cash. Defendant lives out of state. All judges recusing on this case.
136 pm Case recalled. Commissioner Navis now presiding. Minutes filed.
